bestBHT.bht: Faithfully affirm the saying and prioritize practicing good works, as they are profitable and valuable for believers. Insist strongly and persistently on these doctrines, pondering and being anxious about maintaining good works. Take the lead in them, striving to excel and be distinguished in their performance. These good works are honorable, profitable not only for ourselves but also for others. The teachings of grace and the practice of good works go hand in hand, continually reminding and motivating believers to fulfill their duty with diligence.

Henry Alford: Faithful is the saying... and concerning these things I would have thee positively affirm... they who have believed God may take care to practise good works."
...the transition from presiding over to conducting and practising a business was very easy.
These things are good and profitable for men.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: faithful is the saying...the gratuitousness of God's gift of salvation."
concerning these things...insist strongly and persistently...to maintain good works.
these results of doctrine ('good works') are 'good and profitable unto men.'
Albert Barnes: The doctrine which he had stated about the method of salvation was in the highest degree important, and entirely worthy of belief.
Make them the constant subject of your preaching.
These doctrines which he had stated were not mere matters of speculation, but they were fitted to promote human happiness, and they should be constantly taught.
Marvin Vincent: To think or consider; hence to take careful thought, ponder, be anxious about.
The sense here is to be forward in.
John Calvin: But we are reminded, on the other hand, that it is the duty and office of a bishop to affirm strongly, and maintain boldly, those things which are believed on good grounds, and which edify godliness.
He wishes the people to be instructed in such a manner that 'they who have believed God,' may be solicitous, above all things, about good works.
Yet he is not so careful about good works as to despise the root — that is, faith — while he is gathering the fruits.
Philip Schaff: Faithful saying only found in Pastoral Epistles.
Such doctrines cannot be too often enforced.
To practice like a skilled craftsman practical duty, and not idle speculation.
Archibald T. Robertson: That thou affirm confidently (σε διαβεβαιουσθα). Indirect command. For the verb see 1 Timothy 1:7.
That they may be careful (ινα φροντιζωσιν). Sub-final use of ινα with present active subjunctive of φροντιζω, old verb, only here in N.T.

To maintain good works (καλων εργων προιστασθα). Present middle infinitive of προιστημ, intransitive use, to stand before, to take the lead in, to care for. Paul is anxious that 'believers' may take the lead in good works.
John Gill: I will have Titus be assured of those truths himself; be at a point about them, and without any doubt or hesitation concerning them; and abide firm and constant in them, and speak of them with certainty, boldness, and confidence to others.
Nothing can more strongly engage to a studious concern for the performance of good works than the frequent insisting upon the above doctrines of grace.

The doctrines of the Gospel are good, excellent, valuable, and precious, comparable to gold, silver, and precious stones... They are profitable in the hands of the Spirit of God for conviction, conversion, comfort, and edification.
John Wesley: Be careful to excel in good works [...] use their best contrivance, their utmost endeavours, not barely to practise, but to excel, to be eminent and distinguished in them."
[Good works] are amiable and honourable to the Christian profession.
[Good works] are profitable to men — Means of increasing the everlasting happiness both of ourselves and others.

bhtAttempts.bht: It is important to firmly affirm and insist on the truth of the doctrine and to prioritize good works. This affirmation should be confident and unwavering, as the doctrines are valuable and profitable. It is crucial for believers to ponder and be anxious about maintaining good works, taking the lead in them and excelling in them. These good works are not to be taken lightly but should be seen as honorable and profitable, both for ourselves and for others. The doctrines of grace and the practice of good works are closely intertwined, with the teachings serving as a constant reminder and encouragement for believers to be diligent in their obedience.

Faithfully affirm the saying and prioritize practicing good works, as they are profitable and valuable for believers. Insist strongly and persistently on these doctrines, pondering and being anxious about maintaining good works. Take the lead in them, striving to excel and be distinguished in their performance. These good works are honorable, profitable not only for ourselves but also for others. The teachings of grace and the practice of good works go hand in hand, continually reminding and motivating believers to fulfill their duty with diligence.

In light of the faithful saying, it is crucial to affirm and prioritize practicing good works. These works are not only valuable but also profitable for believers. Insist steadfastly on these doctrines, pondering and being anxious about their maintenance. Take the lead in good works, striving to excel and be distinguished in them. Such works are honorable and profitable, contributing to the everlasting happiness of ourselves and others. The teachings of grace and the performance of good works are closely intertwined, serving as a constant reminder to fulfill our duty diligently.

Faithfully affirm and prioritize practicing good works, as they are profitable and valuable for believers. Insist strongly on these doctrines, taking careful thought and being anxious about maintaining good works. Take the lead in them, striving to excel and be distinguished. These works are honorable and profitable, not only for ourselves but also for others. The teachings of grace and the practice of good works go hand in hand, continually reminding and motivating believers to fulfill their duty diligently.

Faithfully affirm the saying about the value of practicing good works, as they are profitable for believers. Insist strongly and persistently on these doctrines, being anxious to maintain good works. Take the lead in them, striving to excel and be distinguished. These works are not only profitable for ourselves but also for others. The teachings of grace and the practice of good works are closely intertwined, serving as a constant reminder and motivation to fulfill our duty diligently.
